titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Rodolphe Meyer de Schauensee (1901-1984) was curator of birds at the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia for nearly 50 years. He was the Academy's vice president from 1940 to 1949 and was a member of the Board of Trustees from 1934 until his death. During his tenure, the Academy's bird collection grew from about 80,000 to over 170,000 specimens, and the scope of the collection was greatly expanded to include many more species not native to North America. De Schauensee was a member of a number of ornithological societies, including the Delaware Valley Ornithological Club. He published over 100 articles and six major books on avian systematics.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of correspondence, manuscripts, and photographs of Rodolphe de Schnauensee. Materials include incoming and outgoing correspondence, 1937-1977, related to identification of specimens, exchange of specimens with other institutions, expedition planning, work being performed by local collectors in Southeast Asia and South America, and other topics related to his work at the Academy. Correspondents include Ernst Mayr and Sidney Dillon Ripley, at the American Natural History Museum, Herbert Deignan, and Thomas Barbour. Materials related to de Schnauensee publications include: manuscript catalogue of the Birds of Siam, in 2 volumes, listing specimen names, references to the initial description, distribution, and measurements; typescript catalog of Siamese birds, in 3 volumes, giving references to initial descriptions; and correspondence related to the publication of Birds of Venezuela and Birds of China. Other materials in the collection include: specimen collecting notebooks, mostly from his trips to Siam, giving specimen number, date, location (sometimes including elevation), sex; film and glass negatives from Schauensee's trips to Thailand and Burma; a small book prepared by Schauensee on collecting shells; photographs; maps; and reprints of articles written by Schauensee.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia: Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia Ornithology Department records; George Miksch Sutton drawings (illustrations for de Schauensee's Birds of Columbia); Collection 628, de Schauensee papers.
